titles.title: Wood Stove Replacement Act of 2005
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit for qualified expenditures paid or incurred to replace certain wood stoves.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 9/28/2005--Introduced. The Wood Stove Replacement Act of 2005 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers a tax credit, up to $500, for the cost of replacing a residential wood stove with one that complies with current Environmental Protection Agency standards. Terminates such credit after 2008.
